intro: Rhinotropis parryi, commonly known as Parry's rhinocereus, is a flowering plant native to the deserts of North America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and spiny stems. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers during the spring and summer months. It is adapted to arid environments, with thick, fleshy stems that store water. Rhinotropis parryi is often found in rocky soils and is a hardy species that thrives in full sun.
